param.name: @spacer
param.label: Page Display
param.description: The following parameters affect how the page will be rendered.

param.name: CSS_CLASS
param.label: CSS Class
param.description: Name of the CSS Class used when displaying results

param.name: TEMPLATE_LANGUAGE_FILE_ID
param.label: Template Language File ID
param.description: The ID number of the template language file to be loaded with the template.

param.name: USE_LANGUAGE_CODES
param.label: Enable Multilingual Descriptions
param.description: If the user's language is not the language defined above, use language codes defined in the template's language file to print descriptions.

param.name: ORDER_AS_FOUND_IN_QUERY
param.label: Order Variables As Found In Query
param.description: If Yes, then variables will be presented on the user interface as they are found in the query, rather than as they are ordered by DBQ.

param.name: SHOW_PRINT_PAGE
param.label: Show Header
param.description: Toggle the displaying of the header page, which contains the name of the query and the print icon.

param.name: @spacer
param.label: Select Query Display
param.description: The following parameters affect how the Select Query view will be rendered.

param.name: HIDE_ON_SELECT_SCREEN
param.label: Hide On Select Screen
param.description: Hide this query on the Select Query screen.

param.name: GET_INPUT_FROM_REQUEST
param.label: Get Input From URL
param.description: By default, DBQ looks for input submitted via a POST request. This option will look for input from the both POST and GET. Enable this option only if you know what you are doing.

param.name: @spacer
param.label: Prepare Query Display
param.description: The following parameters affect how the Prepare Query view will be rendered.

param.name: LOAD_DEFAULT_VALUE
param.label: Load Default Values
param.description: Load or select a default value for keyword or list variables, respectfully.

param.name: DEFAULT_QUERY_THEME
param.label: Form Theme
param.description: The theme used by the form. The CSS file must be located in /components/com_dbquery/themes/

param.name: SHOW_ERROR_STATEMENTS
param.label: Show Statement On Error
param.description: Show the statement on the form when the statement contains input errors.

param.name: @spacer
param.label: Execute Query Display
param.description: The following parameters affect how the Execute Query view will be rendered.

param.name: DEFAULT_LIMIT
param.label: Default Limit
param.description: Default number of rows to display for any results.

param.name: SHOW_RETURN_LINK
param.label: Show Return Link
param.description: Toggle the displaying of the link that returns a user back to the form screen.

param.name: SHOW_FIELD_DESCRIPTION
param.label: Display Field Description
param.description: Display a description of the field. This is a feature of DBQ Professional.

param.name: HIDE_EMPTY_FIELDS
param.label: Hide Empty Fields
param.description: Hide empty fields if all results lack data to display. This is a feature of DBQ Professional.

param.name: SHOW_FORM_ON_NO_RESULTS
param.label: Show Form On No Results
param.description: Toggle the displaying of the Prepare Query Screen form if no results are returned.

param.name: RESULT_TABLE_SORTABLE
param.label: Result Table Is Sortable
param.description: If enabled, users will be able to sort the results on the screen by clicking on the header.

param.name: @spacer
param.label: Custom Code
param.description: The custom code file let's one modify the raw POST input prior to DBQ processing and useful if you must perform checks that DBQ does not.

param.name: CUSTOM_CODE_ENABLED
param.label: Load Custom Code File
param.description: Enable the loading of the custom code file.

param.name: CUSTOM_CODE_FILE
param.label: Custom Code File
param.description: The name of the custom code file that is loaded prior to any DBQ processing.

param.name: @spacer
param.label: Next Query
param.description: This parameter will determine if template variables in the query will be able to link to other queries. THESE FEATURES ARE NOT OFFICIALLY SUPPORTED IN EITHER THE FREE OR PROFESSIONAL VERSIONS! You have been warned.

param.name: NEXT_QUERY_ENABLE
param.label: Next Query Enabled
param.description: Enable a link to the next query. This is a feature of DBQ Professional.

param.name: @spacer
param.label: Data Preload
param.description: Preloading of data can be used when a single record in the database should be loaded for editing via the form. This is a feature of DBQ Professional.

param.name: PRELOAD_ENABLED
param.label: Enable Preloading
param.description: Toggle the preloading of data to be used in the form's variables.

param.name: DATA_SOURCE
param.label: Data Source
param.description: You can preload data for this query either by a simple SQL query, defined below, or a DBQ Query

param.name: PRELOAD_QID
param.label: Preload Query ID
param.description: The Query ID of the DBQ query used to preload data if Data Source is set to 'Query'.

param.name: PRELOAD_SQL
param.label: Preload SQL
param.description: SQL Code that will be used to preload data from the database if Data Source is set to SQL.

param.name: PRELOAD_VARIABLE_NAME
param.label: Preload Unique Key Variable Name
param.description: The name of the variable that will be posted into this form. The value of this variable will be the unique key.

param.name: PRELOAD_VARIABLE_PREFIX
param.label: Preload Variable Prefix
param.description: This prefix will be appended to the names of fields in order to generate a name into which the field data will be preloaded. Thus, if the database field was 'name' and the corresponding variable is 'search_name', the prefix should be 'search_'. This setting applies to all variables.

param.name: @spacer
param.label: Special Popup Functionality
param.description: These parameters pertain to popups and require DBQ Professional.

param.name: POPUP_UPDATES_PARENT
param.label: Popup Updates Parent
param.description: If enabled, a popup will cause the parent to reload.

param.name: POPUP_CLOSES_BY_ITSELF
param.label: Popup Closes By Itself
param.description: If enabled, a popup will close itself in a given number of seconds.

param.name: POPUP_CLOSES_DELAY
param.label: Popup Closes Delay
param.description: The number of seconds a popup will wait before closing itself.

param.name: @spacer
param.label: AJAX Grid
param.description: These settings control the presentation using a grid. To use this feature, the query configuration Expect Rows must be set to 'Yes' and the attribute Page Navigation must be off.

param.name: ZP_GRID_IS_ACTIVE
param.label: Use Grid
param.description: If enabled, the AJAX grid will be used to display data.

param.name: ZP_GRID_USE_FILTERS
param.label: Use Grid Filters
param.description: If enabled, data within the grid can be filtered.

param.name: ZP_GRID_PAGINATION_TYPE
param.label: Pagination Type
param.description: Select the type of pagination used by the user to browse through results.

param.name: ZP_GRID_THEME
param.label: Grid Theme
param.description: The theme used by the grid.
